title.narrative: COVID-19 Crisis Emergency Social Safety Nets Project

description.narrative: The purpose of the COVID-19 Crisis Emergency Social Safety Nets Project in Bolivia is to provide temporary economic support to poor and vulnerable households impacted by the COVID-19 (Coronavirus) pandemic. This project has three components. Component one aims to address the significant impacts of COVID-19 (Coronavirus) on the income of poor and vulnerable households thereby reducing financial barriers to health-seeking behavior, such as social-distancing. This component has three subcomponents: (i) Temporary cash transfers to vulnerable households with children enrolled in schools; (ii) Temporary cash transfer to vulnerable households with pregnant women, children below 2 years old, or disabled and elderly individuals, and; (iii) Support to the payment system for cash transfers during the COVID-19 (Coronavirus) emergency and the project implementation arrangements. Component two will provide support to the transitory expansion of the safety net to informal workers. Component three will Support to the payment system for cash transfers during the COVID-19 (Coronavirus) emergency and the project implementation arrangements.
